intro: Melhania substricta, commonly known as the slender melhania, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. Melhania substricta is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
